titleStmt.title: James L. Sneed et al., Note
CWG8611

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Bazell Hall Forgery Two years nine months Madison June Term 1860
Time Expires Apl 3d 1863
The prisoner has behaved well and we recommend his Pardon

Jas L L Sneed
Clk Ky Penty
L P Prentiss
Assistant keaper --
R W Lawler assistant keeper
J. L. Hockensmith Guard
R K Taylor " "
J. Gallahue " "
L. Tobias
Thos. J. Frazier
R W Wilhoit
I was the attorney for the Commonwealth who prosecuted the prisoner to conviction, and I most earnestly submit his discharge.

W. S. Downey
Comm atty
13th Jud Dist --
I am of opinion upon all the facts to me testified that the within named Bazall Hall should now be pardoned & direct a pardon to issue accordingly 30 Jany 1863

Forgery
2 yrs. 9 mos
Basil Hall
IssdJany 3d 1863
